required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Evaluating Desvenlafaxine Succinate Sustained Release (DVS SR) Versus Placebo in Peri- and Postmenopausal Women
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Randomized, 8-week, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Study Followed by a 6-month Open-label Extension to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of DVS SR in Peri- and Postmenopausal Women With Major Depressive Disorder

lead_sponsor.agency: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

clinical_study.source: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

brief_summary.textblock: Desvenlafaxine succinate (DVS) is a potent and selective serotonin and norepinephrine reuptake inhibitor (SNRI). The sustained-release (SR) formulation, DVS SR, is being studied in the development program for the treatment of major depressive disorder (MDD), for vasomotor symptoms (VMS) associated with menopause, and for pain associated with peripheral diabetic neuropathy, as well as for the treatment of fibromyalgia syndrome. This study will investigate the safety, efficacy, and tolerability of DVS SR in women with MDD who are peri- and postmenopausal.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Hamilton Psychiatric Rating Scale for Depression (HAM-D17) Score From Baseline to Week 8.
primary_outcome.description: HAM-D17 is a standardized, clinician-administered rating scale that assesses 17 items characteristically associated with major depression. Items are scored on a 0 to 2-4 scale (0=none/absent and 4=most severe) with a maximum total score of 50. Change= 8 week adjusted mean HAM-D17 minus baseline adjusted mean HAM-D17

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients With Each Clinical Global Impression Improvement (CGI-I) Score
secondary_outcome.description: CGI-I is a global rating scale that measures disease improvement. Using a 7-point scale, the clinician rates how much the patient's illness has improved or worsened relative to the baseline status (1= very much improved; 7= very much worse).

Remission is defined as a Hamilton Psychiatric Rating Scale for Depression (HAM-D17) score of ≤ 7. HAM-D17 is a standardized, clinician-administered rating scale that assesses 17 items characteristically associated with major depression. Items are scored on a 0 to 2-4 scale (0=none/absent and 4=most severe) with a maximum total score of 50.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients Achieving Response to Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: A response is defined as ≥ 50% decrease from baseline on Hamilton Psychiatric Rating Scale for Depression (HAM-D17) score. HAM-D17 is a standardized, clinician-administered rating scale that assesses 17 items characteristically associated with major depression. Items are scored on a 0 to 2-4 scale (0=none/absent and 4=most severe) with a maximum total score of 50.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Hamilton Psychiatric Rating Scale for Anxiety (HAM-A) Score From Baseline to Week 8
secondary_outcome.description: The HAM-A is a standardized, clinician-administered rating scale that assesses 14 items characteristically associated with major anxiety disorders. Items are scaled 0 - 4 (0=none and 4=very severe), with a maximum total score of 56. Change= 8 week adjusted mean HAM-A score minus baseline adjusted mean score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Dimension Health State EuroQol (EQ-5D) Score From Baseline to Week 8
secondary_outcome.description: EQ-5D is a standardized, subject-administered measure of health outcome. It provides a descriptive profile for 5 dimensions (mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort, anxiety/depression), using 3 levels (no, moderate, or extreme problems) and a single index value characterizing current health status using a 100-point visual analog scale (0=worst, 100=best). EQ-5D summary index is obtained with a formula that weights each level of the dimensions. The index-based score is interpreted along a continuum of 0 (death) to 1 (perfect health). Change=8 week score minus baseline score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Hamilton Psychiatric Rating Scale for Depression (HAM-D17) Score From Open Label Baseline to 6 Months
secondary_outcome.description: HAM-D17 is a standardized, clinician-administered rating scale that assesses 17 items characteristically associated with major depression. Items are scored on a 0 to 2-4 scale (0=none/absent and 4=most severe) with a maximum total s core of 50. Change= Final Evaluation mean HAM-D17 minus baseline mean HAM-D17.

CGI-I is a global rating scale that measures disease improvement. Using a 7-point scale the clinician rates how much the patient's illness has improved or worsened relative to the baseline status (1= very much improved; 7= very much worse)

Remission is defined as a Hamilton Psychiatric Rating Scale for Depression (HAM-D17) score of ≤ 7. HAM-D17 is a standardized, clinician-administered rating scale that assesses 17 items characteristically associated with major depression. Items are scored on a 0 to 2-4 scale (0=none/absent and 4=most severe) with a maximum total s core of 50.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients Achieving a Response to Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: A responder is defined as a patient with ≥ 50% decrease from baseline on Hamilton Psychiatric Rating Scale for Depression - 17-item (HAM-D17) score. HAM-D17 is a standardized, clinician-administered rating scale that assesses 17 items characteristically associated with major depression. Items are scored on a 0 to 2-4 scale (0=none/absent and 4=most severe) with a maximum total score of 50.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Hamilton Psychiatric Rating Scale for Anxiety (HAM-A) Score From Open Label Baseline to 6 Months
secondary_outcome.description: The HAM-A is a standardized, clinician-administered rating scale that assesses 14 items characteristically associated with major anxiety disorders. Items are scaled 0 - 4 (0=none and 4=very severe), with a maximum total score of 56. Change= Final Evaluation mean HAM-A score minus baseline mean score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Dimension Health State EuroQol (EQ-5D) Score From Open Label Baseline to 6 Months
secondary_outcome.description: EQ-5D is a standardized, subject-administered measure of health outcome. It provides a descriptive profile for 5 dimensions (mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort, anxiety/depression), using 3 levels (no, moderate, or extreme problems) and a single index value characterizing current health status using a 100-point visual analog scale (0=worst, 100=best). EQ-5D summary index is obtained with a formula that weights each level of the dimensions. The index-based score is interpreted along a continuum of 0 (death) to 1 (perfect health). Change=8 week score minus baseline score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Discontinuation-Emergent Signs and Symptoms (DESS) Total Score
secondary_outcome.description: DESS: a clinician-administered 43-item assessment that evaluates discontinuation-emergent symptoms resulting from the withdrawal from test article. The DESS total score is the sum of the number of "new symptoms" and "old (but worse) symptoms" (1) and 0 for "old and unchanged symptom," "absent," or "old symptom but improved" for a total possible range of 0 to 43. A higher score indicates more symptoms.

intervention.intervention_name: Desvenlafaxine administered as a succinate salt in a sustained-release form (DVS SR)
intervention.description: DVS-SR 50-200mg, daily (QD), tablet form, treatment period up to 34 weeks
Placebo, daily (QD), tablet form, treatment period up to 8 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Peri- and postmenopausal women between the ages of 40 and 70 years, inclusive.
- A primary diagnosis of MDD, single or recurrent episode, without psychotic features using the modified International Neuropsychiatric Interview (MINI).
- Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) total score > or = 22 at the screening and baseline visit.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Use of oral estrogen-, progestin-, androgen-, or Selective Estrogen Receptor Modulator (SERM)-containing drug products 8 weeks before baseline.
- Current (within 12 months) psychoactive substance abuse or dependence (including alcohol), manic episode, post-traumatic stress disorder, obsessive-compulsive disorder, or a lifetime diagnosis of bipolar or psychotic disorder.
- A history or active presence of clinically important medical disease.
Additional criteria apply.

overall_official.affiliation: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Patients were recruited in the United States from September 2006 to September 2007.

group.title: Desvenlafaxine Succinate Sustained-Release (DVS SR)
group.description: Double-blind Phase Days 1 to 7: 50 mg/day (one 50 mg tablet) Days 8 to 14: 100 mg/day (one 100 mg tables) Days 15 to 56: At the discretion of the investigator, patients assigned 100 mg/day (one 100 mg tablet) or 200 mg/day (two 100 mg tablets) Open-label Phase Days 57-63: 100 mg/day (one 100 mg tablet) Days 64-238: At the discretion of the investigator, patients assigned 100 mg/day (one 100 mg tablet) or 200 mg/day (two 100 mg tablets) Taper Phase Day 239 or at discontinuation: If patient taking 200 mg/day, then decreased to 100 mg for 7 days, and then decreased to 50 mg/day for 7 days. Patients taking 100 mg/day decreased to 50 mg/day for 7 days.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Double-blind Phase Placebo administered daily for 8 weeks Open-label Phase Days 57-63: 100 mg/day (one 100 mg tablet) Days 64-238: At the discretion of the investigator, patients assigned 100 mg/day (one 100 mg tablet) or 200 mg/day (two 100 mg tablets) Taper Phase Day 239 or at discontinuation: If patient taking 200 mg/day, then decreased to 100 mg/day for 7 days, and then decreased to 50 mg/day for 7 days. Patients taking 100 mg/day decreased to 50 mg/day for 7 days.

group.title: Desvenlafaxine Succinate Sustained-Release (DVS SR)
group.description: Double-blind Phase Days 1 to 7: 50 mg/day (one 50 mg tablet) Days 8 to 14: 100 mg/day (one 100 mg tables) Days 15 to 56: At the discretion of the investigator, patients assigned 100 mg/day (one 100 mg tablet) or 200 mg/day (two 100 mg tablets) Open-label Phase Days 57-63: 100 mg/day (one 100 mg tablet) Days 64-238: At the discretion of the investigator, patients assigned 100 mg/day (one 100 mg tablet) or 200 mg/day (two 100 mg tablets) Taper Phase Day 239 or at discontinuation: If patient taking 200 mg/day, then decreased to 100 mg for 7 days, and then decreased to 50 mg/day for 7 days. Patients taking 100 mg/day decreased to 50 mg/day for 7 days.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Double-blind Phase Placebo administered daily for 8 weeks Open-label Phase Days 57-63: 100 mg/day (one 100 mg tablet) Days 64-238: At the discretion of the investigator, patients assigned 100 mg/day (one 100 mg tablet) or 200 mg/day (two 100 mg tablets) Taper Phase Day 239 or at discontinuation: If patient taking 200 mg/day, then decreased to 100 mg/day for 7 days, and then decreased to 50 mg/day for 7 days. Patients taking 100 mg/day decreased to 50 mg/day for 7 days.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Change in Hamilton Psychiatric Rating Scale for Depression (HAM-D17) Score From Baseline to Week 8.
outcome.description: HAM-D17 is a standardized, clinician-administered rating scale that assesses 17 items characteristically associated with major depression. Items are scored on a 0 to 2-4 scale (0=none/absent and 4=most severe) with a maximum total score of 50. Change= 8 week adjusted mean HAM-D17 minus baseline adjusted mean HAM-D17
outcome.population: Double-blind phase; modified intent to treat population, which included all randomized patients with a baseline HAM-D17 score ≥18, who took ≥1 dose of study drug and had ≥1 post-baseline HAM-D17 evaluation. Mixed model repeated measures (MMRM) modeling included all available observed data for each patient and no missing values were imputed.

group.title: Desvenlafaxine Succinate Sustained-Release (DVS SR)
group.description: Double-blind Phase Days 1 to 7: 50 mg/day (one 50 mg tablet) Days 8 to 14: 100 mg/day (one 100 mg tables) Days 15 to 56: At the discretion of the investigator, patients assigned 100 mg/day (one 100 mg tablet) or 200 mg/day (two 100 mg tablets) Open-label Phase Days 57-63: 100 mg/day (one 100 mg tablet) Days 64-238: At the discretion of the investigator, patients assigned 100 mg/day (one 100 mg tablet) or 200 mg/day (two 100 mg tablets) Taper Phase Day 239 or at discontinuation: If patient taking 200 mg/day, then decreased to 100 mg for 7 days, and then decreased to 50 mg/day for 7 days. Patients taking 100 mg/day decreased to 50 mg/day for 7 days.

measure.title: Change in Hamilton Psychiatric Rating Scale for Depression (HAM-D17) Score From Baseline to Week 8.
measure.description: HAM-D17 is a standardized, clinician-administered rating scale that assesses 17 items characteristically associated with major depression. Items are scored on a 0 to 2-4 scale (0=none/absent and 4=most severe) with a maximum total score of 50. Change= 8 week adjusted mean HAM-D17 minus baseline adjusted mean HAM-D17
measure.population: Double-blind phase; modified intent to treat population, which included all randomized patients with a baseline HAM-D17 score ≥18, who took ≥1 dose of study drug and had ≥1 post-baseline HAM-D17 evaluation. Mixed model repeated measures (MMRM) modeling included all available observed data for each patient and no missing values were imputed.

analysis.method_desc: Mixed Models Repeated Measures (MMRM) used baseline as a covariate and factors for center, week and treatment.
analysis.estimate_desc: DVS SR adjusted mean change minus placebo adjusted mean change.

outcome.title: Percentage of Patients With Each Clinical Global Impression Improvement (CGI-I) Score
outcome.description: CGI-I is a global rating scale that measures disease improvement. Using a 7-point scale, the clinician rates how much the patient’s illness has improved or worsened relative to the baseline status (1= very much improved; 7= very much worse).
outcome.population: Double-blind phase, modified intent to treat population, which included all randomized patients with a baseline HAM-D17 score ≥18, took ≥1 dose of study drug and had ≥1 post-baseline HAM-D17 evaluation. Missing data handled by last observation carried forward (LOCF).

analysis.p_value_desc: DVS SR compared to Placebo for CGI-I scores of either 1 (very much improved) or 2 (much improved).

analysis.method_desc: Logistic regression model with treatment and site as factors and baseline score as a covariate.
analysis.estimate_desc: Adjusted odds ratio of DVS SR to Placebo. Odds ratio adjusted for baseline, treatment and site.

outcome.title: Change in Hamilton Psychiatric Rating Scale for Depression (HAM-D17) Score From Open Label Baseline to 6 Months
outcome.description: HAM-D17 is a standardized, clinician-administered rating scale that assesses 17 items characteristically associated with major depression. Items are scored on a 0 to 2-4 scale (0=none/absent and 4=most severe) with a maximum total s core of 50. Change= Final Evaluation mean HAM-D17 minus baseline mean HAM-D17.
outcome.population: Open-label phase safety population: All patients who completed the double-blind phase, elected to continue treatment in the open-label phase, and received at least 1 dose of study drug in the open-label phase. One patient did not have a baseline and at least 1 on therapy assessment.

group.title: DVS SR / DVS SR
group.description: Patients were in the DVS SR arm during both the double-blind and open-label phase.

group.title: Placebo / DVS SR
group.description: Patients were in the Placebo arm during the double-blind phase and the DVS SR arm during the open-label phase.

measure.title: Change in Hamilton Psychiatric Rating Scale for Depression (HAM-D17) Score From Open Label Baseline to 6 Months
measure.description: HAM-D17 is a standardized, clinician-administered rating scale that assesses 17 items characteristically associated with major depression. outcome.population: Open-label phase safety population: All patients who completed the double-blind phase, elected to continue treatment in the open-label phase, and received at least 1 dose of study drug in the open-label phase.

group.title: DVS SR / DVS SR
group.description: Patients were in the DVS SR arm during both the double-blind and open-label phase.

group.title: Placebo / DVS SR
group.description: Patients were in the Placebo arm during the double-blind phase and the DVS SR arm during the open-label phase.

measure.title: Clinical Global Impression Improvement (CGI-I) Score
measure.description: CGI-I is a global rating scale that measures disease improvement. Using a 7-point scale the clinician rates how much the patient’s illness has improved or worsened relative to the baseline status (1= very much improved; 7= very much worse)
measure.population: Open-label phase safety population: All patients who completed the double-blind phase, elected to continue treatment in the open-label phase, and received at least 1 dose of study drug in the open-label phase.

outcome.title: Percentage of Patients Achieving Remission
outcome.description: Remission is defined as a Hamilton Psychiatric Rating Scale for Depression (HAM-D17) score of ≤ 7. HAM-D17 is a standardized, clinician-administered rating scale that assesses 17 items characteristically associated with major depression. Items are scored on a 0 to 2-4 scale (0=none/absent and 4=most severe) with a maximum total s core of 50.
outcome.population: Open-label phase safety population: All patients who completed the double-blind phase, elected to continue treatment in the open-label phase, and received at least 1 dose of study drug in the open-label phase. One patient did not have a baseline and at least 1 on therapy assessment.

group.description: Patients were in the DVS SR arm during both the double-blind and open-label phase.

group.title: Placebo / DVS SR
group.description: Patients were in the Placebo arm during the double-blind phase and the DVS SR arm during the open-label phase.

measure.title: Percentage of Patients Achieving Remission
measure.description: Remission is defined as a Hamilton Psychiatric Rating Scale for Depression (HAM-D17) score of ≤ 7. HAM-D17 is a standardized, clinician-administered rating scale that assesses 17 items characteristically associated with major depression. Items are scored on a 0 to 2-4 scale (0=none/absent and 4=most severe) with a maximum total s core of 50.
measure.population: Open-label phase safety population: All patients who completed the double-blind phase, elected to continue treatment in the open-label phase, and received at least 1 dose of study drug in the open-label phase. outcome.title: Percentage of Patients Achieving a Response to Treatment
outcome.description: A responder is defined as a patient with ≥ 50% decrease from baseline on Hamilton Psychiatric Rating Scale for Depression - 17-item (HAM-D17) score. HAM-D17 is a standardized, clinician-administered rating scale that assesses 17 items characteristically associated with major depression. Items are scored on a 0 to 2-4 scale (0=none/absent and 4=most severe) with a maximum total score of 50.
outcome.population: Open-label phase safety population: All patients who completed the double-blind phase, elected to continue treatment in the open-label phase, and received at least 1 dose of study drug in the open-label phase. One patient did not have a baseline and at least 1 on therapy assessment.

measure.title: Percentage of Patients Achieving a Response to Treatment
measure.description: A responder is defined as a patient with ≥ 50% decrease from baseline on Hamilton Psychiatric Rating Scale for Depression - 17-item (HAM-D17) score. HAM-D17 is a standardized, clinician-administered rating scale that assesses 17 items characteristically associated with major depression. Items are scored on a 0 to 2-4 scale (0=none/absent and 4=most severe) with a maximum total score of 50.
measure.population: Open-label phase safety population: All patients who completed the double-blind phase, elected to continue treatment in the open-label phase, and received at least 1 dose of study drug in the open-label phase. One patient did not have a baseline and at least 1 on therapy assessment.

outcome.title: Change in Hamilton Psychiatric Rating Scale for Anxiety (HAM-A) Score From Open Label Baseline to 6 Months
outcome.description: The HAM-A is a standardized, clinician-administered rating scale that assesses 14 items characteristically associated with major anxiety disorders. Items are scaled 0 - 4 (0=none and 4=very severe), with a maximum total score of 56. Change= Final Evaluation mean HAM-A score minus baseline mean score.
outcome.population: Open-label phase safety population: All patients who completed the double-blind phase, elected to continue treatment in the open-label phase, and received at least 1 dose of study drug in the open-label phase. One patient did not have a baseline and at least 1 on therapy assessment.

group.title: DVS SR / DVS SR
group.description: Patients were in the DVS SR arm during both the double-blind and open-label phase.

group.title: Placebo / DVS SR
group.description: Patients were in the Placebo arm during the double-blind phase and the DVS SR arm during the open-label phase.

measure.title: Change in Hamilton Psychiatric Rating Scale for Anxiety (HAM-A) Score From Open Label Baseline to 6 Months
measure.description: The HAM-A is a standardized, clinician-administered rating scale that assesses 14 items characteristically associated with major anxiety disorders. Items are scaled 0 - 4 (0=none and 4=very severe), with a maximum total score of 56. Change= Final Evaluation mean HAM-A score minus baseline mean score.
measure.population: Open-label phase safety population: All patients who completed the double-blind phase, elected to continue treatment in the open-label phase, and received at least 1 dose of study drug in the open-label phase. One patient did not have a baseline and at least 1 on therapy assessment.

outcome.title: Change in Dimension Health State EuroQol (EQ-5D) Score From Open Label Baseline to 6 Months
outcome.description: EQ-5D is a standardized, subject-administered measure of health outcome. It provides a descriptive profile for 5 dimensions (mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort, anxiety/depression), using 3 levels (no, moderate, or extreme problems) and a single index value characterizing current health status using a 100-point visual analog scale (0=worst, 100=best). EQ-5D summary index is obtained with a formula that weights each level of the dimensions. The index-based score is interpreted along a continuum of 0 (death) to 1 (perfect health). Change=8 week score minus baseline score.
outcome.population: Open-label phase safety population: All patients who completed the double-blind phase, elected to continue treatment in the open-label phase, and received at least 1 dose of study drug in the open-label phase. One patient did not have a baseline and at least 1 on therapy assessment.

group.title: Placebo / DVS SR

measure.title: Change in Dimension Health State EuroQol (EQ-5D) Score From Open Label Baseline to 6 Months
measure.description: EQ-5D is a standardized, subject-administered measure of health outcome. It provides a descriptive profile for 5 dimensions (mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort, anxiety/depression), using 3 levels (no, moderate, or extreme problems) and a single index value characterizing current health status using a 100-point visual analog scale (0=worst, 100=best). EQ-5D summary index is obtained with a formula that weights each level of the dimensions. The index-based score is interpreted along a continuum of 0 (death) to 1 (perfect health). Change=8 week score minus baseline score.
measure.population: Open-label phase safety population: All patients who completed the double-blind phase, elected to continue treatment in the open-label phase, and received at least 1 dose of study drug in the open-label phase. One patient did not have a baseline and at least 1 on therapy assessment.

outcome.title: Discontinuation-Emergent Signs and Symptoms (DESS) Total Score
outcome.description: DESS: a clinician-administered 43-item assessment that evaluates discontinuation-emergent symptoms resulting from the withdrawal from test article. The DESS total score is the sum of the number of “new symptoms” and “old (but worse) symptoms” (1) and 0 for “old and unchanged symptom,” “absent,” or “old symptom but improved” for a total possible range of 0 to 43. A higher score indicates more symptoms.
outcome.population: Open-label (OL) safety population: Patients completed double-blind and continued in OL with ≥1 dose study drug. Excluded patients lost to follow-up and discontinued with <4 wks therapy. Patients analyzed varied by time (0mg, 100mg, 200mg): Early Termination (n=9,98,207); Taper week 1 (n=4,76,193); Taper week 2 (n=5,75,195); Post-taper (n=5,71,192)

group.title: 0 mg
group.description: Placebo

group.title: 100 mg
group.description: DVS SR 100mg dosage was reduced to DVS SR 50mg for 7 days.

group.title: 200 mg
group.description: DVS SR 200mg dosage was reduced to DVS SR 100mg for 7 days and then further reduced to DVS SR 50mg from days 8 to 14.

measure.title: Discontinuation-Emergent Signs and Symptoms (DESS) Total Score
measure.description: DESS: a clinician-administered 43-item assessment that evaluates discontinuation-emergent symptoms resulting from the withdrawal from test article. The DESS total score is the sum of the number of “new symptoms” and “old (but worse) symptoms” (1) and 0 for “old and unchanged symptom,” “absent,” or “old symptom but improved” for a total possible range of 0 to 43. A higher score indicates more symptoms.
measure.population: Open-label (OL) safety population: Patients completed double-blind and continued in OL with ≥1 dose study drug. Excluded patients lost to follow-up and discontinued with <4 wks therapy. Patients analyzed varied by time (0mg, 100mg, 200mg): Early Termination (n=9,98,207); Taper week 1 (n=4,76,193); Taper week 2 (n=5,75,195); Post-taper (n=5,71,192)

class.title: End of 8 week DB / OL phase or early termination

group.title: Double-blind DVS SR
group.description: Days 1 to 7: Patients will be instructed to take 1-50mg tablet per day Days 8 to 14: Patients will be instructed to take 1-100mg tablet per day Days 15 to 56: At the discretion of the investigator, patients may be assigned to 100mg or 200mg tablets per day

group.title: Double-blind Placebo
group.description: Placebo administered daily for 8 weeks

group.title: Open-label DVS SR/ DVS SR
group.description: Patients were in the DVS SR arm during both the double-blind and open-label phase.

group.title: Open-label Placebo/DVS SR
group.description: Patients were in the Placebo arm during the double-blind phase and the DVS SR arm during the open-label phase.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The PIs agreed to allow the sponsor 60 days to review and require changes to presentations or publications but only to protect confidential information and intellectual property, and for the sponsor to file a patent application, as applicable. The PIs also agreed for data to be presented first as a joint, multi-center publication.
